args: Looks like we made it back to the village\nahead of the bear. Now I just need my\nmanacaster!
*gasp* *wheeze* But I thought we\nweren't supposed to use that here!
We're not, but... Oh, I'll explain later!\nWe just need it right now!
Need it for WHAT, though, Sarisse?
BEAR! It's headed for the village!
Here it comes. I'll explain everything\nonce this is over. Now c'mon, Melsa!
Wait! Please, stay away from the village!
No! It's coming straight for us!
That give you a scare?\nHave another taste!
The sound of the shots scared him away...
You attacked the bear with that...that thing!\nHow could you?! Using that man-made\nmonstrosity to murder a part of nature...!
I apologize for using the manacaster\nagainst your wishes, but you were trying\nto avoid harming the bear, weren't you?
Well, this manacaster made that\npossible, so I made the call to use it.
Yeah. That bear has unusually keen ears,\nright? So I realized a loud enough noise\nwould convince it this place wasn't safe.
That may be true, but...! I mean,\nyes, there's nothing here we use in\nour daily lives that's that loud...
Right. Which is why some animals have\nnever learned to steer clear of your home.
So by making a sound that doesn't exist\nin nature, you taught them that this is a\nscary place they should stay away from.
Exactly. So you should see fewer animals\ncoming into your village from here on. I\nAM sorry for breaking my promise, though.
But it was to help protect the animals you\nguys care so deeply for. To protect nature.
Using a human war-machine not to sully\nthe land, but to spare it...
Yes! A manacaster can just as easily save\na bear's life as end it. You understand how\nanimals behave. Am I wrong here?
No, I... I suppose not. Our sylvan ways\nwouldn't have saved that bear.
We owe it all to you...and that caster.
Perhaps...I've been a bit too wary of\nhumans and their ways.
Sarisse, was it? It would please me if\nyou'd come by our woods now and again\nto hunt. If you'd like, that is.
Hearing those shots may help the animals\nunderstand the bounds between our land\nand theirs better. Keep them safe.
It'd be my pleasure! I'll hunt here with\nthe utmost respect, to help preserve\nthis beautiful forest.
She was always a deft hand with the\nbow, but she has a real talent with that\nmanacaster as well.
Hey, {player_name}. Luca. What\nbrings you two to the practice range?
I caught wind of a rumor about a certain\nsylvan village with bear trouble and the\nplucky hero who saved the day.
Oh, that? Heh heh. What can I say? Guilty\nas charged. I was pretty proud of that one!
Well, consider me proud of you, too.\nThat village was always a bit leery of\nus humans.
But they've warmed up to talks with us\nover the last few days.
Using human technology to preserve the\nsylvan way of life... Quite brilliant, really.
Ha ha, I'm glad you're so impressed!\nThat whole incident made me realize\nsomething important, too.
Yeah! How important it is to understand\nother people, places, and cultures!
I want to be the chief of my own village\nsomeday. That's why I need to get busy\nlearning about the outside world now.
The way I figure it, the more I learn now,\nthe better a leader I can be then!
Wise words. And I believe I have just the\nopportunity for you to put them to practice.\nDon't you think, Luca?
Ugh, you're really gonna send me up north\nwith this gremlin in tow?
I'd like to ask a favor of you, Sarisse. You\nknow that we're beginning to have more\ndealings in North Grastaea lately, yes?
I've been thinking of sending Luca on a\nscouting mission to have a look at one of\ntheir cities.
I was hoping I could persuade you to\naccompany him.
Whaaat?! North Grastaea?\nI've never been! Sign me up!
Flash forward to you whining about the\ncold and throwing a tantrum about wanting\nto come home. Look, just—
I'm not a CHILD, Luca! This is a wonderful\nopportunity to learn about another culture.\nOf COURSE I'm on board.
Ha ha! I'm glad to hear it. I'll leave the\nmatter to you two, then. Noelle will serve\nas your guide.
Ugh... Fine. Guess I can't complain about\nwhat's basically a vacation. Just don't go\ngetting lost on me, gremlin.
Obviously! Ooh, I'm so excited... I'm\ngonna study the HECK outta this place!
